alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Garvin; Hughes; Lincoln; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 02 at 7:36PM CDT until May 02 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Garvin County in southern Oklahoma... Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... Southern Lincoln County in central Oklahoma... Southeastern Cleveland County in central Oklahoma... Northwestern Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Pottawatomie County in central Oklahoma... Northwestern Hughes County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern McClain County in central Oklahoma... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 736 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Meeker to 3 miles east of Pink to near Slaughterville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Southeastern Norman, Shawnee, Seminole, Tecumseh, Holdenville, Slaughterville, McLoud, Wewoka, Prague, Stratford, Konawa, Wetumka, Byng, Meeker, Maud, Earlsboro, Bowlegs, Asher, Tribbey and Wanette. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Cleveland; Garvin; Hughes; Lincoln; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
